identificationModule.briefTitle: Dynamic Neural Systems Underlying Social-emotional Functions in Older Adults
identificationModule.officialTitle: Dynamic Neural Systems Underlying Social-emotional Functions in Older Adults

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Assess the impact of a remote, app-delivered digital meditation intervention on emotional well-being of lonely older adults. Neuroimaging and autonomic physiology will be used to assess the neural correlates of the intervention.

armGroups.label: intervention
armGroups.description: Participants will engage with the digital meditation app delivering the intervention 15 min a day, five days, a week for 6 weeks.

armGroups.label: waitlist control
armGroups.description: Participants will be randomized to a waitlist group for six weeks. The waitlist control group will then be able to use the meditation app for six weeks as the primary intervention group

interventions.name: intervention
interventions.description: the digital meditation app will be installed on participants iPad or android. Lonely older adults will use the app five days a week for six weeks total. Neuroimaging will be performed before and after the intervention.

interventions.name: waitlist control
interventions.description: Participants in the waitlist group will have to wait six weeks after being screened before being able to use the meditation app after the assessment of primary and secondary endpoints

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the Warwick Edinburgh Mental Well Being Scale WEMWBS
primaryOutcomes.description: WEMWBS ranges from 14-70, with higher values indicating higher mental well-being
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in well-being from baseline to directly after completing the intervention (6 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the 20-item UCLA loneliness scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: This scale ranges from 20-80, with higher values indicating higher loneliness
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in loneliness from baseline to directly after completing the intervention (6 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the General Anxiety Disorder-7 (GAD-7)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This scale ranges from 0-21, with higher values indicating higher anxiety
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in anxiety from baseline to directly after completing the intervention (6 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: This scale ranges from 9-72, with higher values indicating higher stress
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in stress from baseline to directly after completing the intervention (6 weeks)

secondaryOutcomes.description: This scale ranges from 0-27, with higher values indicating higher depression
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change in depression from baseline to directly after completing the intervention (6 weeks)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 60 years of age or older
* English language fluency
* Naive to meditation practices (not actively meditating more than one hour per month and/or meditation practice for less than a year in their entire life-time)
* No MRI contra-indications
* Cognitively healthy (no diagnosis of dementia, stroke, developmental disorders, or major systemic diseases that may impact cognitive function)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Below 60 years of age
* Not fluent in English
* Active meditator (meditating more than one hour per month and/or meditation practice for more than a year in their entire life-time).
* Presence of a severe psychiatric (e.g. schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, PTSD), neurological (epilepsy, traumatic brain injury, dementia, multiple sclerosis), or developmental disorder (e.g. autism)
* Systemic disease (e.g. major recent surgeries, cancer)
* Claustrophobia
* Contraindications for MR safety (e.g. metal in body, cochlea implants)
